guide.title: Gentoo on the PowerPC
guide.subtitle: Main Page
guide.abstract: The Gentoo on PowerPC project focuses on porting the Gentoo experience to the ppc 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.

ti.i: Posted on 21 July 2003 by Pieter Van den Abeele

ti.p: Heya, if you're reading this that means you've found the new Gentoo for PowerPC page. The purpose of this page is to provide ppc users with fine grained usefull information about Gentoo/PPC. I could fill an entire newspaper with Gentoo powerpc related news, but I'll try to list the most important current news first. This page will be update on a regular basis. All information regarding gentoo on powerpc or subprojects will be availabe from this page or pages linked from this page.

Gentoo/PPC 1.4 will be released on Linux World Expo. On the expo a two disc GRP PPC install disc will be presented to the public. Also a new KDE/GNOME livecd will be available. The kde/gnome livecd presented by the ppc team will be a bugfix release compared to the previous livecd released a few weeks ago. We feel that everyone should be able to build his/her own ppc livecds, so we're currently writing documentation for the livecd scripts. These livecds will be sold trough the gentoo store and will spice gentoo/PPC budget which will be managed in a transparant way to the user community.

Gentoo on the PowerPC G5 will be available after the 1.4 release. G5 machines can be delivered to us on the 11th of august, but we're lacking funds to buy one. So, if you are able to lend us such a machine or to sponsor us in buying one, that would be greatly appreciated.

A new subproject was announced today, called gentoo-ppc-stable. We're currently setting up mailinglists etc. The purpose of this project is to ensure the ppc stable profile is stable, up to date and well tested. As a lead for this project, Bartosch Pixa aka DarkSpecter presented himself. Ferdinand Klinzer will be helping him out on this. Feel free to join this team to ensure a high quality of all ports marked stable on Gentoo/powerpc.

As Gentoo moves to a non-profit and well-structured organization, ppc also needs to get organized. We're currently in the process of doing that. Subprojects will be announced on this page, each with their own homepage.
If you're interested in helping out in the ppc-team, don't hesitate contacting us using ppc@gentoo.org, or any of the ppc mailinglists.
